text: Madeleine Korbel Albright (born Marie Jana Korbelová; May 15, 1937 – March 23, 2022) was an American diplomat and politician of Czech-Jewish descent. She was born in Czechoslovakia. Her father was Josef Korbel. She was the first woman to become United States Secretary of State. She was appointed by President Bill Clinton on December 5, 1996. Ninety-nine United States Senators voted to confirm her. No senator voted against her. She was sworn in (taking office) on January 23, 1997. She was a professor at Georgetown University before her death. Before she was Secretary of State, Albright was the U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations. She began at the UN on February 6, 1993. Albright died on March 23, 2022 from cancer in Washington, D.C. at the age of 84. ==Books== *Madam Secretary (2003) *The Mighty and the Almighty: Reflections on America, God, and World Affairs (2006) *Memo to the President Elect: How We Can Restore America's Reputation and Leadership (2008). *Read My Pins (2009). == Related pages== *List of women diplomats from the United States == References == Category:1937 births Category:2022 deaths Category:20th-century American politicians Category:21st-century American politicians Category:Cancer deaths in Washington, D.C.
